segment.source: Using the SUA Tool (Windows 10)
segment.target: Using the SUA Tool (Windows 10)

segment.source: By using the Standard User Analyzer (SUA) tool, you can test your applications and monitor API calls to detect compatibility issues with the User Account Control (UAC) feature.
segment.target: By using the Standard User Analyzer (SUA) tool, you can test your applications and monitor API calls to detect compatibility issues with the User Account Control (UAC) feature.

segment.source: Using the SUA Tool
segment.target: Using the SUA Tool

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: By using the Standard User Analyzer (SUA) tool, you can test your applications and monitor API calls to detect compatibility issues with the User Account Control (UAC) feature.
segment.target: By using the Standard User Analyzer (SUA) tool, you can test your applications and monitor API calls to detect compatibility issues with the User Account Control (UAC) feature.

segment.source: The SUA Wizard also addresses UAC-related issues.
segment.target: The SUA Wizard also addresses UAC-related issues.

segment.source: In contrast to the SUA tool, the SUA Wizard guides you through the process step by step, without the in-depth analysis of the SUA tool.
segment.target: In contrast to the SUA tool, the SUA Wizard guides you through the process step by step, without the in-depth analysis of the SUA tool.

segment.source: For information about the SUA Wizard, see Using the SUA Wizard.
segment.target: For information about the SUA Wizard, see Using the SUA Wizard.

segment.source: In the SUA tool, you can turn virtualization on and off.
segment.target: In the SUA tool, you can turn virtualization on and off.

segment.source: When you turn virtualization off, the tested application may function more like the way it does in earlier versions of Windows®.
segment.target: When you turn virtualization off, the tested application may function more like the way it does in earlier versions of Windows®.

segment.source: In the SUA tool, you can choose to run the application as Administrator or as Standard User.
segment.target: In the SUA tool, you can choose to run the application as Administrator or as Standard User.

segment.source: Depending on your selection, you may locate different types of UAC-related issues.
segment.target: Depending on your selection, you may locate different types of UAC-related issues.

segment.source: Testing an Application by Using the SUA Tool
segment.target: Testing an Application by Using the SUA Tool

segment.source: Before you can use the SUA tool, you must install Application Verifier.
segment.target: Before you can use the SUA tool, you must install Application Verifier.

segment.source: You must also install the Microsoft® .NET Framework 3.5 or later.
segment.target: You must also install the Microsoft® .NET Framework 3.5 or later.

segment.source: The following flowchart shows the process of using the SUA tool.
segment.target: The following flowchart shows the process of using the SUA tool.

segment.source: act sua flowchart
segment.target: act sua flowchart

segment.source: To collect UAC-related issues by using the SUA tool
segment.target: To collect UAC-related issues by using the SUA tool

segment.source: Close any open instance of the SUA tool or SUA Wizard on your computer.
segment.target: Close any open instance of the SUA tool or SUA Wizard on your computer.

segment.source: If there is an existing SUA instance on the computer, the SUA tool opens in log viewer mode instead of normal mode.
segment.target: If there is an existing SUA instance on the computer, the SUA tool opens in log viewer mode instead of normal mode.

segment.source: In log viewer mode, you cannot start applications, which prevents you from collecting UAC issues.
segment.target: In log viewer mode, you cannot start applications, which prevents you from collecting UAC issues.

segment.source: Run the Standard User Analyzer.
segment.target: Run the Standard User Analyzer.

segment.source: In the Target Application box, browse to the executable file for the application that you want to analyze, and then double-click to select it.
segment.target: In the Target Application box, browse to the executable file for the application that you want to analyze, and then double-click to select it.

segment.source: Clear the Elevate check box, and then click Launch.
segment.target: Clear the Elevate check box, and then click Launch.

segment.source: If a Permission denied dialog box appears, click OK.
segment.target: If a Permission denied dialog box appears, click OK.

segment.source: The application starts, despite the warning.
segment.target: The application starts, despite the warning.

segment.source: Exercise the aspects of the application for which you want to gather information about UAC issues.
segment.target: Exercise the aspects of the application for which you want to gather information about UAC issues.

segment.source: Exit the application.
segment.target: Exit the application.

segment.source: Review the information from the various tabs in the SUA tool.
segment.target: Review the information from the various tabs in the SUA tool.

segment.source: For information about each tab, see Tabs on the SUA Tool Interface.
segment.target: For information about each tab, see Tabs on the SUA Tool Interface.

segment.source: To review and apply the recommended mitigations
segment.target: To review and apply the recommended mitigations

segment.source: In the SUA tool, on the Mitigation menu, click Apply Mitigations.
segment.target: In the SUA tool, on the Mitigation menu, click Apply Mitigations.

segment.source: Review the recommended compatibility fixes.
segment.target: Review the recommended compatibility fixes.

segment.source: Click Apply.
segment.target: Click Apply.

segment.source: The SUA tool generates a custom compatibility-fix database and automatically applies it to the local computer, so that you can test the fixes to see whether they worked.
segment.target: The SUA tool generates a custom compatibility-fix database and automatically applies it to the local computer, so that you can test the fixes to see whether they worked.
